fi.marketing.list.logic.lists

Class MarketingList

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.marketing.list.logic.lists.MarketingList

  • public class MarketingList
extends Object
    MarketingList is important part of the process, since we want to know where and when each customer contact were used. A consent can be used if it is no older than two years.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MarketingList(String name)
      A new MarketingList is always named, since we want to track who and when was contacted and whether he or she accepted the offer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToCampaign(Type type, List<Customer> customers)
      Each customer has a list of consents which we want to compare a) which is the most up-to-date consent within all consents and b) is that consent still valid.
      Timestamp getCreated()
      The time when the marketing list was generated can be obtained.
      Timestamp getEarliestAllowedDate()
      Every MarketingList has a best after date, since we cannot use the oldest consents.
      List<Consent> getListOfConsents()
      The list of Consents can be obtained from the marketing list.
      String getName()
      The name of the marketing list can be obtained.
      int getRows()
      The number of rows in the marketing list can be obtained.
      String printString()
      The contents of marketing list can be printed.
      boolean selectActiveConsents(Consent one)
      The timestamp of each consent is compared so as to obtain only the valid consents.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MarketingList

        public MarketingList(String name)
        A new MarketingList is always named, since we want to track who and when was contacted and whether he or she accepted the offer. The timestamp is generated at the same time.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of MarketingList generated.

    • Method Detail

      • getEarliestAllowedDate

        public Timestamp getEarliestAllowedDate()
        Every MarketingList has a best after date, since we cannot use the oldest consents.
        Returns:
        gives a timestamp that is the earliest possible to be used in the marketing list.

      • addToCampaign

        public void addToCampaign(Type type,
                          List<Customer> customers)
        Each customer has a list of consents which we want to compare a) which is the most up-to-date consent within all consents and b) is that consent still valid.
        Parameters:
        type - is the type of consent we are collecting, for instance emails
        customers - is the list of customers

      • selectActiveConsents

        public boolean selectActiveConsents(Consent one)
        The timestamp of each consent is compared so as to obtain only the valid consents.
        Parameters:
        one - is the consent we want to investigate
        Returns:
        is true if the consent is no older than best after and no younger than the time of marketing list was created

      • getListOfConsents

        public List<Consent> getListOfConsents()
        The list of Consents can be obtained from the marketing list.
        Returns:
        is the list of consents collected to the marketing list

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        The number of rows in the marketing list can be obtained.
        Returns:
        is the number of rows in the marketing list

      • getName

        public String getName()
        The name of the marketing list can be obtained.
        Returns:
        is the name of marketing list

      • getCreated

        public Timestamp getCreated()
        The time when the marketing list was generated can be obtained.
        Returns:
        is the timestamp when the marketing list was created.

      • printString

        public String printString()
        The contents of marketing list can be printed.
        Returns:
        is the list in string format.
